intro: Arabis caerulea, commonly known as wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces clusters of small, bright blue or purple flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Arabis caerulea is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
